divs: sighting detailson 10\22\08 @ approximately 1830 hrs. mst i observed a bright white light about the size of a quarter (from my backyard) west of grand junction, colorado. i grabbed my digital camera and zoomed in as close as i could and observed a diamond shape. as i watched, two more lights, one on each side, appeared. i thought it might be inbound air traffic to our regional airport, but the light did not progress any further, but instead seemed to recede or become smaller. i continued to watch the lights and observed the two lights on the sides go dark. then the object turned red, and then amber. i observed the light for a half an hour, then went inside to get warm. i observed it from inside the house a little longer (15 minutes or so) and then it went dark altogether. the following night approximately around 2000 hrs i looked in that same direction to see if anything was there, and it was there in the same area of the sky. i told my wife and she came to the back porch to see. i grabbed the camera and zoomed in on it and snapped two pictures, but all that the pictures showed was a squiggly line. my wife grabbed a pair of binoculars (8x21) and i watched for 10-15 minutes. i observed the diamond shape again through the binoculars. sometimes it appeared as a sphere and the diamond shape would not be visible. i trained my binoculars on a star nearby to compare. the observed object was much brighter than the star. the object turned red, and then amber, then appeared to recede or become smaller. i entered the house to watch some more, but the object went dark. i flashed my 4d maglite flashlight at it 3 times to see if it would respond, but nothing else was observed. i sat on the couch and watched t.v. for an hour. i returned to the back porch around 2200 hrs. and the light was there in the same area of the sky. i watched it for a short time (approx. 5 minutes), and told my wife about it. i returned to watching t.v. and did not observe anything else that evening. tonight, 10\24\08, i noticed it again around 1945 hrs. doing the same things: changing size (or receding), changing colors, and hovering in the same spot.i decided to see if anyone else had reported it to mufon so i called mufon colorado and continued to observe the light while on the phone. i have military experience (u.s.n) and i was stationed at an air base and i have never seen any sort of military aircraft doing these sort of manuevers. i know helicopters can fly backwards, but i have not seen them turn red and amber, or turn into spheres of light.
